Description: Necklace (?): a string composed of twenty-one amethyst spherical beads of various sizes strung alternately with twenty-one leaf-shaped pendants of electrum foil. The latter are made by curving over the edges of a sheet of foil and pinching the tops together. A hole is pierced through the top for threading. The pendants are open on the reverse side.
Curator's comments: Cf. T. E. Peet & W. L S. Loat, ‘The Cemeteries of Abydos, part III. 1912-13 (London, 1913), pl. IX, group 1; J. Garstang, ‘el Arabah’ (London, 1901), pl. I, from tomb E 108; C. M. Firth, ‘Archaeological Survey of Nubia, 1910-11’ (Cairo, 1927), pl.28a, 7; J. Garstang, ‘The Burial Customs of Ancient Egypt’, (London, 1907), fig. 100, central string: all Middle Kingdom. Middle Kingdom examples of this type of leaf-shaped pendant have open backs, often plaster-filled; New Kingdom examples have back-plates soldered to them.
Bibliographic references: Andrews 1981 / Catalogue of Egyptian Antiquities. Jewellery I (556)
Exhibition history: Exhibited: 1997 13 Oct-1998 5 Jan, India, New Delhi, National Museum, The Enduring Image 1998 9 Feb-3 May, India, Mumbai, Sir Caswasjee Jahangir Hall, The Enduring Image
Condition: fair (pendants worn). BS records that the object was restrung.
